title: Alexander Skarsgard cuts a casual figure in white shirt and jeans
text:
He's starring in the upcoming war film The Kill Team.

And Alexander Skarsgard came out to push the final product on Tuesday as he appeared at a screening of the film in New York City.

The 43-year-old screen star kept comfortable in a cream-colored utility shirt over a white T-shirt with distressed medium wash jeans on the bottom.

Stylish: Alexander Skarsgard came out to push The Kill Team on Tuesday at a special screening

He navigated the event in grey suede chukka boots and accessorized with a black wristwatch.

His costar Nat Wolff and director Dan Krauss were by his side for the screening.

The Kill Team centers on 'a young soldier in the U.S. invasion of Afghanistan who witnesses other recruits killing innocent civilians and considers reporting them to higher-ups as the heavily-armed, increasingly violent platoon becomes suspicious that someone in their ranks has turned on them,' Variety reports.

Co-workers: His costar Nat Wolff and director Dan Krauss were by his side for the screening

Skarsgard recently opened up to Esquire on his opinions of various menswear staples.

He expressed that he embraces winter menswear because 'here’s a lot more to play around with because of layering and the amount of accessories.'

'You can have a nice scarf with a trench coat or combine it with sweaters and jerseys,' he added.

Dapper: Skarsgard recently opened up to Esquire on his opinions of various menswear staples

And although the boots he wore to the screening were squeaky clean, Skarsgard admitted he likes shoes best when 'you can tell they're worn.'

'I almost think it looks a bit weird on the red carpets when everything’s shiny and brand new - I think it’s better when it’s worn and there’s a history behind the shoe. If you keep everything pristine and super-clean it just radiates doubt,' he said.

The Kill Team hits theaters everywhere on Oct. 25.
